title: Drawing, "Design for Painted Ceiling Decoration", 1775–1800
medium: Black chalk and black crayon on heavy cream paper, squared for enlargement
inscribed: Inscribed in black chalk at lower right in a 20th century hand: T. Conca / (23) 14
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Design for a lunette.  Two standing and one seated putti (in the middle) with musical instruments (trumpets and tambourines), shown against the trapezoidal frame of an oculus.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Painted Ceiling Decoration", 1775–1800.
1775–1800. Black chalk and black crayon on heavy cream paper, squared for enlargement. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-7186.
